description: Linked Art is a Community working together to create a shared Model based on Linked Open Data to describe Art. We then implement that model in Software and use it to provide valuable content. It is under active development and we welcome additional partners and collaborators.
label: Linked Art

Addition.description: The addition of some entity to a Set
Addition.label: Addition

Phase.description: The period of time during which an entity is in a certain phase or state of its existence.  The phase can be physical (the box is open, the painting is 14 ft wide) or social (the sculpture is owned by some Actor, the building is used as a castle).
Phase.label: Phase

Removal.description: The removal of some entity from a Set
Removal.label: Removal

RightAcquisition.description: The acquiring or establishment of a particular E30 Right over some entity
RightAcquisition.label: Right Acquisition

access_point.description: From an ur- digital object to a single concrete representation. A locator as opposed to an identifier, similar to the approximated_by for Place.
access_point.label: access point

current_permanent_custodian.description: This property records the normal custodian of the object at the time when the assertion was made. The object may have a temporary custodian, for example when it is loaned to another organization for an exhibition or between departments for conservation or storage.
current_permanent_custodian.label: Current Permanent Custodian

equivalent.description: Similar to skos:exactMatch, the referenced entity is an equivalent instance to the referencing entity. This would not have the same inference issue as exactMatch, whereby the domain and range become skos:Concept, which is equivalent to E55_Type ... and thus everything becomes a Type.
equivalent.label: has equivalent instance

established_by.description: The RightAcquisition that established this Right
established_by.label: established by

establishes.description: The right established by a RightAcquisition
establishes.label: establishes

has_phase.description: The relationship between an E1 Entity and one of its Phases. A painting that had two sizes, 16 feet and 14 feet wide, would have two Phases, one for each width.
has_phase.label: has phase

initiated.description: Events can start or initiate Phases, such as the Modification of a painting to trim it from 16 feet to 14 ft would initiate a 14 feet phase, or the Acquisition of a sculpture by some Actor would initiate that Actor's ownership phase. This relationship links the initiating Event to the Phase.
initiated.label: initiated

invalidated_by.description: The RightAcquisition that invalidated this Right
invalidated_by.label: invalidated by

invalidates.description: The right which is invalidated by a RightAcquisition
invalidates.label: invalidates

property_classified_as.description: Record dot one properties via Attribute Assignments
property_classified_as.label: Property Classified As

related_entity.description: An E1 Entity that defines the nature of the Phase. For an ownership phase, this would be the owning E39 Actor. For the size of painting phase, this would be the E54 Dimension that describes the size.
related_entity.label: related entity

terminated.description: Events can end or terminate Phases, such as the Modification of a painting to trim it from 16 feet to 14 ft would end the 16 feet phase, or the Acquisition of a sculpture by some Actor would end the seller's ownership. This relationship links the terminating Event to the Phase.
terminated.label: terminated

relationship.description: The relationship between the Entity that the phase is of, and the defining entity. For an ownership phase, this would be P52 has current owner. For the size of painting phase, this would be P43 has dimension.
relationship.label: related by
